meanings.definition: The growth of one thing into or within another.
meanings.sent1: The intergrowth of vines in the forest creates a dense canopy.
meanings.sent2: The intergrowth of roots in the soil makes it hard to transplant the tree.
meanings.sent3: The intergrowth of spaghetti on my plate made it look like a tangled mess.
meanings.sent4: The intergrowth of ideas in her mind led to a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent5: The intergrowth of ivy on the wall gave the building a natural, green facade.

meanings.definition: A growth that is intertwined with another.
meanings.sent1: The intergrowth of the two vines made it hard to separate them.
meanings.sent2: The intergrowth of hair strands in the brush showed how tangled it was.
meanings.sent3: The intergrowth of yarn in the knitting project created a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: The intergrowth of branches in the dense forest formed a natural barrier.
meanings.sent5: The intergrowth of flavors in the dish created a delicious blend.
